meanings.definition: Blooms (noun): The flower or blossom of a plant.
meanings.sent1: In the garden, the blooms of the roses added color and beauty.
meanings.sent2: The blooms on the cherry tree signaled the arrival of spring.
meanings.sent3: The bee buzzed happily from bloom to bloom, collecting nectar.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a bloom, brightening up the room.
meanings.sent5: The fragrance of the blooms filled the air with sweetness.

meanings.definition: Blooms (verb): To produce flowers; to flourish or thrive.
meanings.sent1: With proper care, the plant blooms beautifully every year.
meanings.sent2: After the rain, the desert blooms with colorful wildflowers.
meanings.sent3: The town blooms with excitement during the annual festival.
meanings.sent4: Her talent for music blooms as she practices every day.
meanings.sent5: Hope blooms in the hearts of those who never give up.

meanings.definition: Blooms (adjective): Having a healthy, vibrant appearance.
meanings.sent1: The garden looked stunning with all the blooms plants.
meanings.sent2: Her artwork always has a vibrant and blooms style.
meanings.sent3: The party was a blooms affair with colorful decorations.
meanings.sent4: His enthusiasm for the project was truly blooms.
